newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Death toll rises to six in Lisbon bridge accident.
newsitem.headline: Death toll rises to six in Lisbon bridge accident.

text.p: The death toll from an accident at a bridge being built over the river Tagus at Lisbon has risen to six with the discovery of the body of the last missing worker, a spokeswoman for the construction company said on Saturday.
The body of 37-year-old Aboubacar Cisse, an immigrant worker from Guinea Bissau, was found by divers late on Friday night.
Two French engineers were amongst those killed when a girder plunged 40 metres from the bridge to the bank of the river on Thursday. A British engineer remains in a deep coma in a Lisbon hospital.
The 18-km (11-mile) bridge over the Tagus, due to be completed in 1998, is being built by the Anglo-French consortium, Lusoponte. It is due to be completed in 1998.
